benchmark_details.name: Continuous-Valued Seed Dataset for Word-Order Typology
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a new seed dataset made up of continuous-valued data for linguistic typology that reflects the variability of language, focusing on word-order typology extracted from the Universal Dependencies corpus.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset that better represents linguistic variability and improve performance on NLP tasks that utilize typological information.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is small, covering fewer than 100 languages across a limited number of features, which may affect the generalizability of analyses.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated to evaluate the performance of regression models predicting linguistic features.
methodology.interpretation: Lower mean squared error indicates better predictive performance; R2 Score closer to 1 shows better fit.
